Description: Date and time of data collection
Maximum wind speed up to that point in the day
Time of maximum wind speed up to that point in the day
Direction of maximum gust up to that point in the day
Maximum temperature up to that point in the day
Minimum temperature up to that point in the day
Maximum fuel temperature up to that point in the day
Minimum fuel moisture up to that point in the day
The date and 15min time interval the data was recorded

Notes: This does not run continuously through the record; every time a new program is sent or the logger is power-cycled, the program restarts and record number starts back at 0

Has historically been reported to underestimate windspeeds due to corrosion on the bearings. Bearings should be replaced every 1-2 years or whenever large discrepancies appear between Windspeed sensors

Description: Wind Direction from a wind vane
Notes: Wind vane tail tends to get off-kilter in high winds; it still returns good values, just need to tighten it up with an allan wrench

Description: Maximum wind speed recorded via a cup anemometer during the 15min interval
Notes: Has historically been reported to underestimate windspeeds due to corrosion on the bearings. Bearings should be replaced every 1-2 years or whenever large discrepancies appear between Windspeed sensors
Need to make sure the North markers on the sensor head are aligned north.

Description: Maximum wind speed during the 15min interval
Average incoming solar radiation during 15min interval
Notes: Good idea to wipe the dust and bird poop off occasionally

Description: Total incoming solar radiation summed during the 15min interval
Notes: Good idea to wipe the dust and bird poop off occasionally
Will sometimes produce values over 100% during rainfall events but usually 100-103%

Description: The number of tips of the rain bucket (.01 in) during the 15min interval
Notes: Guy wires and a screen on the bottom help prevent wind driven tips and wasp colonization respectively

There is a continous 250mV floating charge on the sensor that responds in the postive direction when mositure forms or falls on the sensor. Not all but some rain events that occur after long dry spells will begin with LW values below 250mV …maybe dust on the sensors that creates a temporary film

Description: Cumulative rainfall since the start of the water year (Oct 1 – Sep 30)
Notes: This value will automatically reset to zero if the station losses power or something else crazy happens. For the purpose of this spreadsheet I like to populate this column by manually summing up "rainInch15min Formula"

Description: This is a postprocessed product of rainHun15min / 100
Notes: By performing a running total on this column I can QC and in some cases produce the "rainInchYear" data.

Description: The date and 60min time interval the data was recorded
Date and time of data collection
The date and 60min time interval the data was recorded
